website_summaries.verdict: Large-size bottle of mold stain remover that is all-purpose for removing not only mold but other stains, too.
pros: The cleaning formula can remove moss, mildew, and algae stains in addition to mold
Mixed with water, the bottle makes around three gallons
cons: For the best results, the stain remover requires hard scrubbing after sitting for a while

customer_reviews.title: DANGER!  Very Hazardous Product
customer_reviews.text: The information provided on-line includes: "Gentle Spray & Leave Cleaner, No Scrubbing, Rinsing or Power Washing Safe For Virtually Any Surface, Bleach-Free, Biodegradable, Non-Acidic, No Phosphates." Once I read the label it reads in part: "Corrosive, Causes irreversible eye damage and skin burns. Harmful if swallowed or absorbed through the skin. Do not get in eyes, on skin, or on clothing. Wear protective eyewear (safety glasses or face shield), protective clothing, and rubber gloves...." There several more warnings on the label including it is unsafe to dispose of into a sewer system. I tried to return two bottles due to the lack of safety information provided on the site, but was declined: “For safety reasons..."
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Pay Attention to Volume of Product
customer_reviews.text: I have used the product before. It produces very good results on mildew and stains. My one star rating is based solely on the fact the volume of product is not prominently posted in the listing and I thought I was buying a gallon size container not a .5 gallon size. At only $5.00 more for a gallon size, there is absolutely no reason to buy a .5 gallon size. Guess what? PRIME does not provide free returns on this item! Please pay closer attention to the volume of product than I did. 🤪
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read the Warning Label! This is a Very Dangerous Chemical!
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea if this stuff works as advertised but I bought Wet and Forget because it was marketed as noncaustic, pet and plant friendly. So, when I applied it, I wasn’t too concerned. However, after I applied it, I noticed the warning label hidden behind the main label and OMG! The caution statement reads like I have only two weeks to live. You can’t touch it, breath it, get it in your eyes. You have to discard your clothes if they become drenched and you must wash off your pets if they come in contact with it before it dries.
customer_reviews.author: Concerned

customer_reviews.title: My Aunt Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my aunt for here house, porch and deck. She loves it and says it works great. Believe me if you knew my Aunt, coming from her...That means something. If was junk she would let me know. Also she found the best price here and as always shipping was fast and on time. Will buy again for her next year! If you found my review helpful, please click below. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony E.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product.
customer_reviews.text: got results in 30 days on tombstone that was covered with mold. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: bluebird   T

customer_reviews.title: Product description is very misleading!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to receive this product today and use it on my patio furniture cushions. After reading the full product description online it clearly stated that it can be used on all outdoor surfaces including patio furniture, hammocks, and patio umbrellas. To me this made it clear that it was safe to use on fabrics. After I received the product and was about to use it, I was reading the uses and instructions on the bottle and it states that it is not to be used on patio furniture cushions. The online description is very misleading!
customer_reviews.author: Joel Breeggemann

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive Ad.  Very Poor Value.
customer_reviews.text: Wet and Forget is great stuff and it does exactly what it says it will. Normally you find this stuff in one gallon containers for this price point. This listed says nothing about the fact that these are 1/2 gallon jugs. So the price per gallon here is about double of what a big box store charges. Don’t get surprised like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Biff E Waters

customer_reviews.title: Forget this product
customer_reviews.text: I used this as directed on some modest build-up of moss and mildew on a brick walkway. It did absolutely nothing. I repeated it 3 times with the same result. I tried hosing down and scrubbing 24 hours after a 3rd application. Zero help. I then did a test, side-by-side, of hot water vs. this product, and hot water was at least as effective if not more so. If you are considering purchasing this product, my suggestion: forget it.
customer_reviews.author: gr8tfuldad2003

customer_reviews.title: Not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I received this concintrate this morning. I mix up a batch using the 5 to 1 ratio in a 1.5 gallon sprayer. I sprayed the mild and waited the suggested 12 minutes. It did nothing to the mold. I added another 400 ml. Now a total of 2000ml in the 1.5 gal. I sprayed again and after the 12 minutes the mold was still there. I bought this product because I did not want to have to buy a power washer. I have been a Amazon customer since 2003. I know there is no return on this product. I am requesting a Full refund for this product. Thanks Karl
customer_reviews.author: karl

customer_reviews.title: Bait and Switch
customer_reviews.text: Beware. This jug looks exactly like the one gallon size. I have bad eyes and thought I was buying the same one as the 1 gallon size. This is a .5 gallon jug. I feel I was ripped off. And, this item is not eligible for return.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: Didn't really work for me. Every year I have serious mold problems on my lanai pavers during the rainy season (I live in SW Florida). I had high hopes but this product basically did nothing. I mixed it at the appropriate ratio and made sure to only apply during cloudy conditions where it could just sit for 5 or 6 hours. Even when I used a scrubber and repeated applications I still couldn't get the stains out. I probably would have been better off using plain old bleach. What ultimately worked for me was Marine 31.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Basterson

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me......stripped my paint off
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed.......I followed instructions precisely on my painted white rocking chairs that were mildewed ......it did nothing but strip my paint on both of my 99.00 each white rocking chairs....so I am left with two rocking chairs I have to sand and repaint.
customer_reviews.author: Janis

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is my second review. I used this last summer. I had just bought the house the previous fall. So, I power washed the moss off, then sprayed this product. It made the spots I missed, disappear. It has ALSO, not let any new moss stuff show up. I HIGHLY SUGGEST THIS PRODUCT! :) I wish I would have taken before and afters :/
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Blalock

customer_reviews.title: It works but it may take some time.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in the spring of and used it on black mildew and green algae and it worked well. I hoped to spray my driveway to remove black mildew buildup. I tried a little test patch and after several days and rain, I couldn't tell the difference from the test patch and adjacent driveway. However, over time it worked. The attached photo was taken a week or so ago after 3.5 years. You can easily see the rectangular whitened area. No other treatments have been made. Bottom line spray it on and forget it and it will improve your drive way looks for years.
customer_reviews.author: JoeWillie

customer_reviews.title: Though I was buying a gallon
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed. I was lead to believe I was buying a gallon for 24.00. I recieved only half a gallon. Then found out I can get one gallon for 29.00 Got ripped off
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This Stuff Works!
customer_reviews.text: Does it work? Just see the picture below and see if you can tell where I didn't spray at. Wonderful product, easy to use, highly recommend. The only negative is how long it takes to work but as long as you apply it in spring, you'll be looking good by summer.
customer_reviews.author: zack lones

customer_reviews.title: Forget about it
customer_reviews.text: I mixed and applied this product per instructions, on a dry 60-degree cloudy day 7 weeks ago. It has rained often since then. The black streaks and stains on my driveway and sidewalk are exactly the same as they were before, no difference. The algae is still present on the roof. The only thing it affected were green stains on the cement pad for my shed, which disappeared the next day. Waste of time and money. UPDATE: After 5 months there is no difference in the black streaks on my driveway.
customer_reviews.author: me

customer_reviews.title: Does not give you instant results but be patient and you will be very happy. I use it everywhere
customer_reviews.text: Every home owner should own this. I use it every year and my house looks brand new. No scrubbing required, you literally spray it and walk away. Does not give you instant results but be patient and you will be very happy. I use it everywhere. Cement patio, vinyl trim, wood.... everything.
customer_reviews.author: CapeCodder

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing. DESTROYS algae. Super easy to use. I used to have to scrub this crap off of my siding, and it was exhausting and never really got all of it. With this stuff, you spray it once and within a day the green is gone. Within two months, the rest is gone.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Watts

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: sprayed this on moss and lichen that grown on my shed roof. I soaked half the roof.. Used half the container (one container costs $27!) One week later it's exactly the same. On the other side, i used dollar store bleach and it worked in 15 minutes.. moss went from green to yellow/dead and i was able to brush off the next day. i should have tried that in the first place.. thought this must be some magic stuff based on the decent reviews. Dont' waste your money on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Drewbius Maximus

customer_reviews.title: green algae/mold whatever green stuff on a white vinyl fence gone in 2 days
customer_reviews.text: green algae/mold whatever green stuff on a white vinyl fence gone in 2 days! black stuff- not so much. But the label says that could take 1-6 weeks so I will wait. Spraying goes well with the Roundup Sprayer sold on Amazon-- I have the 5 gallon one but the 2 gallon would probably do for most people.. You have to hand pump but 15 down strokes gets me through two 8' fence sections pretty quickly. The wand sprayer I tried first that runs on batteries and came with Roundup in it--meh. way slow and tedious.
customer_reviews.author: P. Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: nope
customer_reviews.text: carefully read the directions... in the print it says do not expect instant results, may take months for visible results. Bought and applied in mid august per instructions and writing this review in january... nothing, nada. I gave it one star because that's the lowest one and it had wet in the name and it was indeed a liquid when I got it. For the price of the bottle ($25)and depending on your driveway you will probably need 2... just buy a driveway pressure washer head ($55) instead. For the couple of hours I spent mixing and applying this I could have been over halfway done actually washing it.
customer_reviews.author: Stefany L. Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Buy this stuff
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing. I live in a town in western NC that averages 67 inches of rain a year — more than twice the national average. My mid century modern home was a mess. The main path to the house was almost always slippery. I had tried power washing but it never lasted. After applying this stuff my house gets a little cleaner every time it rains. It’s also fun to watch. Not good for speedy results. But I expect its results will be longer lasting.
customer_reviews.author: Actuality

customer_reviews.title: Decent product
customer_reviews.text: Used it on pontoon carpet that was in terrible shape. Could tell a difference in a month after two applications but still ended up pressure washing it. Used the last third on house vinyl siding. That worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Nick B

customer_reviews.title: Worked well on walkways, vinyl siding and fiberglass roof shingles.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Had green slimy moss on a number of sections on the pavers on my walkway. One spray of this stuff, and in 2 hours the green was dark brown. 1 weeks later black. and now I watch it get lighter and lighter each time it rains. Same goes for the vinyl siding I sprayed and my roof. My roof had green moss growing at the bottom of a few courses (covered in the shade). I sprayed, and same thing... went brown, then more and more fell off each time it rained.
customer_reviews.author: Ace

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely one of the best products I have ever used. Parts of my stone patio were absolutely black. The stone in the photo was covered in black mold or fungus. I mixed and applied with a sprayer. It doesn’t work immediately. Took about two week. I thought I was going to have to scrub the rock by hand. I have bought it again. Does exactly what it says it will do. I have used it on concrete and it worked just as well. I would give it 10 stars if I could
customer_reviews.author: Dave and Gayle

customer_reviews.title: Magic?
customer_reviews.text: I think this stuff is magic. My car had years of scuz built up from being parked in the shade, under a tree. I was worried about scuffing paint and damaging the rubber. So I got this stuff. I sprayed every edge, corner, inset a few times over a few weeks. The greenish stuff turned grayish. And it came off pretty easy with a wet sponge. I did gingerly use a toothbrush in some tight areas (eg around the door handles).
customer_reviews.author: Jason Osgood

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't work better!
customer_reviews.text: Our patio was covered in the green algae and I did not want to pressure wash it. I found this and decided to give it a try. I followed the directions on the bottle and sprayed it on the day before it was going to rain. The bottle says that it can take months to work but I noticed all the green had turned to a rust brown within 30 minutes of me spraying it. After two days of rain, all the algae is gone. Love this product!
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This product works great. But it does take a little time. The photos below were taken about a month after spraying. You can clearly see where I sprayed and where I didn't. The improvement started around 15 days but takes at least 30 for maximum improvement.
customer_reviews.author: Book reviewer 2005

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product! Complete waste of money!!
customer_reviews.text: I followed the directions properly! I used the product... It did ABSOLUTELY NOTHING!! Just in case... I waited a week... tried again... and once again... ABSOLUTELY NO EFFECT! I feel cheated!
customer_reviews.author: Oraglo

customer_reviews.title: Great product for killing Moss or algae on your roof.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to kill some moss on a part of my roof that is typically in the shade. One application killed the moss completely highly recommended for moss and algae removal.
customer_reviews.author: Richie Rich

customer_reviews.title: Effective on Algae; Not So Much on Moss
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on the algae covered stucco and it did a great job in just two days. But because the surface was vertical, I had to mildly "scrub" the solution around with a soft roof brush--that made the difference. It did not do well at all on moss encrusted shingles, though it did kill the moss and turn it brown. I recently tried it on regular architectural-style roof shingles--even with some brushing--and ti was ineffective. Probably works well on decks, too; so say my friends who have used it. Next, I'm going back to try 10% Clorox which does a fine job on my walkway.
customer_reviews.author: James Charnock

customer_reviews.title: This product works
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why there are the negative reviews--I followed the directions and applied to the side of my home, patio furniture, deck, etc. about a week ago and am seeing a dramatic reduction in the mold/moss. Maybe people are expecting immediate results vs. allowing the product to do its job by 'wetting & forgeting'? I will update this in a few months and raise to 5 stars if it completely removes/kills the mold/moss.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Forget it, it (doesn't) does work
customer_reviews.text: I applied it a few months ago on a small section of my roof and i have noticed no difference. So I guess that's why they want the name of it to be called wet it and forget it because they don't want you to see that it doesn't work. I have amended my review to now say that it did work. I was removing moss from my roof. It took over 6 months with 2 applications 3 months apart. It took about 8 months. I now think the reason was that roots of the dead moss held it on the shingle for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Too Poor Steve

customer_reviews.title: Works better & safer than bleach
customer_reviews.text: I have green algae growing on part of my roof that stays in the shade. First noticed it last yr & sprayed with bleach. Bleach killed the algae for a few months but the runoff hurt the bushes at the bottom of the gutter downspout. This time I soaked the algae with Wet & Forget. I forgot to check it the next day then went out of town for a week. When I got back, it was totally gone. I was skeptical that it would work & thought if it did work, it would take weeks. I was pleasantly surprised how quickly it worked & hope it will keep the growth away for a yr like it advertises.
customer_reviews.author: Julie and Bill D.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work at all on sidewalk
customer_reviews.text: I diluted the product according to the instructions and applied it in the shade to a pretty warm sidewalk in front of my house. I suppose that had I applied it during a time that would have been cooler (with slower evaporation), it would have worked better. As it stands, there is no noticable difference between the treated area from the untreated area. This might work on some surfaces but not on my sidewalk. It does, however, kill any grass it touches. On a positive note, I did apply it twice to a small patio area and got better results. What I see as prohibitive with this product is the amount needed (cost) to accomplish the job.
customer_reviews.author: kent

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After much research in an attempt to find an alternative to pressure washer purchased this product. Followed directions and it did not work on siding. Ended up using pressure washer.
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower

customer_reviews.title: Cleans the house without a professional team
customer_reviews.text: I'm a repeat user and know that Work and Forget works well to clean algae and mildew on our siding and other outdoor home items. This version requires a sprayer (but is less expensive than the pre-mix). It's not fast and you first see the algae begins to die, but after a few days you stop watching to see if it's working. Then a few weeks later and a few rains, I noticed my home is clean! I have neighbors that have professionals clean their siding at a high price and a few than have siding that looks terrible. I like the Wet and Forget choice.
customer_reviews.author: Les

customer_reviews.title: GREAT! Worked overnight.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would have taken a before and after but I am super happy with this product. We had a leaking sprinkler in our front yard that was running down our sidewalk and had been leaking for so long that it started growing slippery algae. This had been going on for months and months. We turned the sprinkler off once we figure out which was leaking with our lawn company. I put the water and product onto the sidewalk overnight and woke up the next morning to a perfectly normal and clean sidewalk. WOW! I recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Worked on outdoor table umbrella
customer_reviews.text: We had some algae staining on a light brown outdoor table umbrella that had been closed and tied most of the time. The algae appeared in the creases and we were worried it would not come out. I used this product as instructed and the algae disappeared with just one use. I let it sit as described with the umbrella down but untied (did no additional scubbing) and the stains disappeared in a month or so. Very pleased. Would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: jbh

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this product. It doesn’t work and Amazon will not take it back!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this product. It does not work. It says on the bottle “Reaction Time: ...could take 6-12 months...” Also, amazingly enough Amazon can ship it to you, but they will not take it back! I ordered 2 bottles and when it did not work wanted to return the unopened bottle, but Amazon rejected the return because its liquid. Don’t buy this rip off product
customer_reviews.author: Larry W., Carlsbad, CA

customer_reviews.title: Only product for moss control
customer_reviews.text: Every spring I need to spray down my concrete driveway, blacktop parking spot, and several wood and stone walkways to kill off moss. Using this product, I find I have less to do the next year. I dilute as instructed and spray once, some areas maybe a second spray two weeks later to make sure it is all brown. Heavy deposits I powerwash, otherwise I leave the corpses to scare off future moss. Effective and doesn't damage anything. This is a very wooded area so moss is inevitable, at least with this I can maintain some control.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: Forget that you paid money for this
customer_reviews.text: This product is garbage. Applied it several times per the instructions, and nothing. No change in the mold on my shingles. They call it wet and forget so you'll forget that you actually paid money for it. Waste! Would have been better off to use bleach and water mixture in a pressure spray. Garbage!! Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Janet S

customer_reviews.title: Works Great...
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2 story house with a metal roof and could not get the pressure washer up there without falling off of the wet roof. I was going to rent a lift and i seen this product. I put it in a pump sprayer and soak down the North side of the house that was green and black. In a little over a month it looks as good as new.
customer_reviews.author: Kenny

customer_reviews.title: Green is Gone and Plants are just fine.
customer_reviews.text: My outside Pink Flamingos were turning green and with one spray they are pink again. Also have yellow siding on my house that was turning green in places and so sprayed in on and in two days all green was gone. Great stuff and doesn't hurt plants.
customer_reviews.author: Kittycatbooks

customer_reviews.title: Great masonary and marble cleaner
customer_reviews.text: I use it to clean gravestones. Using a pump up sprayer soak them down, brush with soft bristle brush and hose 'em down again then leave for six months. Best to do during a dry period. This stuff soaks up in the stone and rain can wash it out/ dilute it. I've turned blackened infant gravestones pure white in six months with only a few applications. Even cleaned up the little lamb on top. In case you are wondering about a guy who cleans gravestones, it's my hobby.
customer_reviews.author: Candyspaw

customer_reviews.title: Black stains on shingles....not so good
customer_reviews.text: After 30 days and two applications, I see no change in the black mold on my roof shingles. I did spray this product on some green stuff growing on a shaded yard barn with good results but I bought it for the black stains on roof.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK!!
customer_reviews.text: This product did nothing! I had 4 chairs that were the same, mildewed. Sprayed 2 of them and marked them for comparison, after a couple months no change so I treated them again.. now several months later still nothing. This stuff does absolutely nothing Had a little mildew on a building and treated it also, no change. Do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B

customer_reviews.title: Make sure what you are ordering is what you intended
customer_reviews.text: I’ve ordered and used this product multiple times in the past. This time I just went to my ordered items and reordered, thinking I was ordering (2) 1 gallon containers. It arrived yesterday as (2) - 1/2 gallon containers. I check this morning and this vendor has a no return policy. I got to pay the same per 1/2 gallon (or very close to the same) as I had been paying for 1 gallon containers Lesson learned - watch container sizes and return policy. In general I have been happy with ordering thru Amazon, but this leaves a sour taste
customer_reviews.author: Frank Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Very Effective
customer_reviews.text: My concern is that this is toxic and unless you read the MSDS which is on the fold out label (it should be more visible) you won’t automatically take the precautions you should . As far as how well it works it’s great. 3 months later after a lot of rain and 1 hurricane my concrete is still clean with no sign of returning growth. Just be careful mixing and handling this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works on moss
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works on moss, a recurring problem. Worked on brick pavers as well as shrub beds. I had tried a variety of other products including iron in beds without success, especially after a week. This stuff worked. This product is a concentrate to be diluted for use. Instructions are lacking/inadequate. I think correct dilution is about 10 oz per 64 oz original applicator container; balance with water. Seems dumb for mfgr to not make clear/easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Elbow work required if you expect results
customer_reviews.text: I used this four time following the instructions to the T, so far I'm not very impressed with the extremely little results. My 4th application to the granite headstone was last fall, I made a visit to the Cemetery yesterday (4-7-19) and gave the stone another treatment, but I'm confident that I'm going to have to use brushes of various sizes to clean up the stone properly before Memorial Day.
customer_reviews.author: David White

customer_reviews.title: works slowly
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to give this product a bad review, but if you use it you will have to be very patient. I applied it and it was slowly working as the product states. I am not a patient person after 2 weeks, so I purchased zinc sulfate and applied it to the affected areas on my roof. All moss was dead in 2 more weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Worked overnight!!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this stuff was going to take awhile to work, but it worked 100% overnight! My wood privacy fence had sections covered in green mold. Sprayed this stuff on and walked away. Mold gone! I will say, it’s pretty nasty stuff. I wore a respirator, gloves, goggles, and heavy clothing. Don’t get this stuff on you.
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing!
customer_reviews.text: We used this product to try and clear up some of the moss that was growing on our cement patio in between the stones. We mixed it as directed, and then poured over the concrete pavers. Within a couple days, the moss had dried up and was dead. After spending HOURS last summer pulling out the moss by hand, I knew I needed something to help this year, as I'm in my final pregnancy months and wouldn't be able to bend over and manually clear out the moss. I'm so glad I found this product. I'll be purchasing it next year as well.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: 1st application was sprayed per instructions. 4 hours later, it rained. No difference. 2nd application was also sprayed per instructions and left 3-4 days before any rain. Still no difference. Roof (3D asphalt shingles) is about 15 years old and looks good everywhere except under an Oak tree and gutter "trails". Those where the areas sprayed. House is about 1700 sqft so I estimate it would take 1.5 - 2 of these to get ONE good coverage. It did not work for me. Will try something else.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: This product is so toxic,
customer_reviews.text: it says on the peel away first aid instructions, hidden on the back of the product, that any contact with your skin requires you rinse the effected area for FIFTEEN TO TWENTY MINUTES! Safe, I don't think so. It has other warnings for your children and pets of the same nature.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical, but I applied this liquid per the directions on a hot and sunny day. It seemed to evaporate as I applied it, but in about 3-4 months the moss and algae had disappeared. 6 months after application the roof looks great. I am really impressed with this Wet & Forget. I just did my in-laws roof too - but chose a cloudy day to apply it. Both applications were made using a pump garden sprayer. Very easy to mix and apply.
customer_reviews.author: D Runner

customer_reviews.title: Works to kill mold.  But is not preventative.
customer_reviews.text: During the rainy season we have lots of mold build up in between the pavers on the lanai. It is like a thick felt when I try to lift/dig it out with a knife. I use the Wet and Forget as soon as I see the mold developing. It kills the mold but I still need to power wash out the strips of dead mold between the pavers or scrape it out and then sweep.
customer_reviews.author: sandyTop Contributor: Bread Making

customer_reviews.title: Effective but poor value.
customer_reviews.text: I found this product very effective for North Side green mold on stucco and it keep it off for years. 1 star on value. Shop the price. You’ll get twice as much than .5 gallons for less money at a big orange box store.
customer_reviews.author: Pal Sek

customer_reviews.title: spray that green right out of you yard!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works!!!!! I am surrounded with trees. Needless to say algae everywhere. Double driveway and stairs up to house concrete. Followed directions. Ok , I didn't see a difference. Thought another failed. More rain. A couple weeks later I noticed IT WORKED! and is still working.
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: This product does not work as stated. We have sprayed the mold several times and scrubbed a couple but the black stuff is still on the Brick.
customer_reviews.author: esslinj

customer_reviews.title: Working, killing the black mold that has been there for years.
customer_reviews.text: Yes! it is working. OK it does not look like a new driveway but better. I understand this is not an over night action, takes time. I am letting it work for another month and may update this review. It does not go real far. I used the entire bottle, mixed, and did not complete the two car drive and the front door sidewalk. Could see a difference so I ordered another gallon to finish off.
customer_reviews.author: Barb in MI

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I used Wet and Forget on a patio fence that had been waterproofed two years ago but had gathered black mildew spots due to a wet and rainy winter and spring. At first I followed the product directions and just sprayed it on and waited for it to work. That method was minimally effective. So I ordered a second bottle of Wet and Forget, mixed it with water myself, then went to my local five and dime store, bought brush and Brillo pad hand scrubbers, put on rubber gloves and scrubbed it on that way. That method worked quite well and the fence looks new. Now I just need to apply a better waterproofing finish before winter comes.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Newcomer

customer_reviews.title: Takes too long!
customer_reviews.text: I had a heavy build up of algae on my patios. I started power washing them and got too impatient...it was too time consuming and the results were streaky. I bought this hoping it would work a little quicker and sprayed a section to test, but after 3 weeks I could barely tell the difference. I ended up power washing all the patios anyway, but the area I had sprayed this on did come clean quite a bit easier. I may end up treating them to prevent future buildup just to use the product up.
customer_reviews.author: nisey

customer_reviews.title: Skeptical to impressed
customer_reviews.text: Have a composite deck that seems to attract mold. Last year I was on my hands and knees scrubbing the deck to get rid of it. I purchased this product after reading reviews as it seemed to good to be true. Sprayed it on and after a few weeks noticed all the mold on the deck was gone. Noticed some of the railing has some mold on it so ordering again to see if I can just spray it on there and let it do it's job. Will report back in a few more week.s
customer_reviews.author: Denstl

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised, very surprised actually
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on my sidewalk and driveway. I applied in the fall and come spring I didn't have to pressure wash. I left one square undone for a control and it was full and dirty, while the rest of it was looking great and cleaned.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: This product really works!
customer_reviews.text: I'm generally a little skeptical when something seems to good to be true but this product is amazing, it really works not only as advertised but actually exceeded expectations. The label clearly states that the product might take up to 6 months to work for heavily stained areas, in my experience it worked noticeably in a 24 hour period. Now it's been about 4 weeks since I applied it and my entire outdoor kitchen looks like I pressure cleaned (probably even better)! I loved it so much I went out and bought more and now I'm spraying it on everything, driveway, brick walls of my house, etc. If I see any mold, algae, mildew, etc. I'm spraying it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Calvo

customer_reviews.title: Did nothing, scam
customer_reviews.text: I put it on the same bricks as in their advertising and it did absolutely nothing also sprayed it on a wall that the sprinkler was hitting and getting mildew and mold and again absolutely nothing. I think you are better just mixing bleach and water and using that as it seems to have worked 100% compared to this. I feel like I've been scammed.
customer_reviews.author: Truth and nothing but ...

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't tell you in the description on Amazon that it takes months to work.
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't tell in the product description on Amazon that this stuff takes months to work. You have use a microscope to read the label on the bottle to find that out. If you want a clean exterior to your house for the summer then you had better power wash it and then put this stuff on. There is no way to control the flow at the applicator. When you turn to water on at nozzle, so it needs some kind of trigger built in to the applicator.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Murray

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Really didn’t work - bleach worked the same ---> Get Gutter Butter; stuff is AWESOME on gutters/down spouts, awnings, etc... expensive but the stuff works. Bleach & simple green would not remove the black gutter stains, but gutter butter did. (I threw out the remaining amount of this container it was so bad)
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Soetje

customer_reviews.title: If it seems too easy it’s probably not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It’s been 2 months and Black is still there. Honestly think it made it worse not better :( Edit: Since this never worked, we mixed equal parts vinegar and dawn, sprayed it on and let it sit for 20 minutes. Light scrub and light power wash. ALL GONE 👍
customer_reviews.author: Shella Koke

customer_reviews.title: Huh?
customer_reviews.text: Sounds like the answer to lots of our problems.... ordered it and applied. But the small print: takes up ot 6 months to actually work?! I could have powerwashed the darned stuff. And in 6 months... you apply again! I think we can just use this stuff as a garage paper weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kermit

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great on our roof. Hubby diluted it but not quite as much as directions said. He did use an old wire brush to loosen mold a bit then used a spray canister to apply. Did a great job without affecting roof shingle color. He also sprayed moss on our stone wall.....turned brown and he was able to brush it off. Strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Zarrella

customer_reviews.title: Works great on vinyl siding and wood fences
customer_reviews.text: If you don't have a pressure washer to clean your vinyl siding or your wood fences, this product is for you. You spray it on and let it work. No rinsing required. It does, however, take time for the mildew to go away, but it will keep your vinyl siding and wood fences looking great.
customer_reviews.author: kristi sexton

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy this !!!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't do a thing to get black mold off your cedar pergola !!!! They say it takes a year to work because by the time you find out it don't work you will not be eligible for a refund !!!
customer_reviews.author: TD

customer_reviews.title: Very deceptive advertising.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product with great results and satisfaction. My problem with this purchase is that it is for 1/2 gallon size. I can buy 1 gallon at Lowes for less that $30. I thought I was getting two gallons and saving some money. Basically paid almost twice as much as I could have purchased locally. Yes, I know BUYER BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: bgbigman

customer_reviews.title: Melt away mold and mildew
customer_reviews.text: I had a light amount of mildew on the siding on the back of my house. It was enough to give it a green tint and be visually unappealing. I mixed and then applied this with a pump spray and after about a day all the green was gone. So easy took about 15 minutes to apply.
customer_reviews.author: Alan T

customer_reviews.title: Works great but a small container.
customer_reviews.text: My mistake but I thought I was ordering the same size as I had purchased before but it's half the size! Please note this is a half a gallon and not a full gallon size!
customer_reviews.author: info overload

customer_reviews.title: This didn’t work as well as I had hoped on ...
customer_reviews.text: This didn’t work as well as I had hoped on my flagstone walkway, which would become slippery after a rain. I followed the directions exactly, diluting the product with water, spraying it on and waiting for a few months. There may have been a slight improvement, but it was still slippery. On some of the stones near my front door, I then scrubbed it on full strength. This seems to have really helped. I am now trying this on the rest of the walkway.
customer_reviews.author: Linda C.

customer_reviews.title: Wow, Simple and it works. I had green ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, Simple and it works. I had green mold stains on top of my canvas tent over my deck. They have been there since last year. I sprayed this stuff on and the next day they were gone! Yesterday I sprayed down an indoor-outdoor burber carpet I have on the same deck that has lots of mold stains on it. Today there is a little improvement but I imagine this application will take longer due to the mold stains being imbedded in carpet fibers and not thin canvas. The directions do say it can take 6 to 12 months before all stains are gone. It also says it can be applied every 4 weeks as needed.
customer_reviews.author: David Schulpius

customer_reviews.title: Poor Results
customer_reviews.text: Followed the directions and absolutely nothing happened. The discoloration from moss and mildew were there just as before. Cannot recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pghgrl

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work for me
customer_reviews.text: Applied product as directed on my asphalt shingle roof and it did not change the appearance at all or appear to work in any way.
customer_reviews.author: AJFII

customer_reviews.title: Take note of the size (1/2 gallon)!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not really a review but more of a comment to potential buyers. This is 1/2 gallon not 1 gallon. I mistakenly chose this item as it was in Amazon’s suggestions with a lower price. Since it was only a few dollars less than the gallon size from a competitor I didn’t notice the size difference. It was my fault for not making sure it was an exact match. Hopefully this helps someone else keep from making the same mistake. You can get twice the product for almost the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Rip off
customer_reviews.text: Rip off.... So ultimately my fault but I bought off Amazon after I was looking of websites of Home Depot, Lowes, etc. Saw the price of $27 which was right in line with the price of 1 gallon of this from those other places. Just arrived turns out for $27 you could have a gallon and no returns as flammable....My fault for speed shopping on Amazon and not noticing that it was only half a gallon. Don’t make the same mistake I did.
customer_reviews.author: Dan L.

customer_reviews.title: Works really good!
customer_reviews.text: Used twice, early Spring. Didn't stain the pavers or concrete. Green algae was gone in 2 days, hasn't harmed the Rose's. Follow directions exactly.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: looks goos so far
customer_reviews.text: my sunsetter awning was terrible . I should have taken before and after pictures . Its been a month or so and i will apply a second application . To me , it has improved a lot . The second application and time will tell . Even at this point in time I recommend this product and most likely will purchase more in the future .
customer_reviews.author: jon1481

customer_reviews.title: Best, easiest, safest, mold cleaner ever
customer_reviews.text: I had neglected my wood deck since it was built in 1999. It was almost completely black with mold. I tried various other cleansers with brooms, power washers, etc, with varying success. All told, I scrubbed and powered that deck at least a total of 7 or 8 times over 2 months. My final foray came with Wet and Forget with a power wash finish. Now, 2 months later, it looks like new; unbelievable.
customer_reviews.author: jkwdo

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME product to get rid of mold & mildew anywhere. Buy the $20 concentrate and mix 5:1 water:W&F and spray away. I used it on cedar shakes, white vinyl fence, white pvc lawn chairs, outdoor roll-out shade, wooden deck you name it. Even my indoor bathroom shower! Forget bleach, this doesn’t harm anything. Really, like the name says, just Wet & Forget! No scrubbing! Will definitely buy this again👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: Bobcat15

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: Took a chance and used this to get rid of the mold/algae on the back (North side) of my house. I have tan vinyl siding. I followed directions with mixing it and sprayed it using a 1 gallon pump sprayer. I sprayed in the evening a few hours before sunset. Temps were in the 70’s, there was no rain in the forecast and the sun was not shining directly on the siding. Within a couple days the green color of the algae was turning brown and a few days later there wasn’t any trace of it. Definitely will use again.
customer_reviews.author: ET

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if this would work but oh my goodness, I simply sprayed it on, no scrubbing, and the green stains disappeared from my concrete! No harsh chemical smell, no residue, no effort. A couple of months have gone by and I have not had to reapply. Extremely happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DoodleBop

customer_reviews.title: Not happy with shorted delivery
customer_reviews.text: The large box arrived today, but there was only one half gallon bottle of “Wet and Forgot” in the box. There was supposed to be 8 gallon bottles delivered to me. There were no receipt papers inside the box either. The box did have a good bit of tape on it. The weight written on the box was 38 pounds, so the other bottles were probably inside at the beginning. The box is big enough to hold 8 bottles, but there was only ONE inside.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah

customer_reviews.title: Works great, just spray and wait for the weather to do all the work!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for all my cement sidewalks and back patio, also old garden stones. It takes awhile to see results, but results you will get! Between the sun and daily rain here in Florida, it doesn’t take long to see results. If you’re patient and don’t want to bust your back with a pressure washer, this is the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Georgina Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: Worked great with elbow grease
customer_reviews.text: I used it on my grandmother's headstone, after it was neglected many years. It's situated under a huge tree, so the black dried droppings and lichen had taken over. It took a few rounds of cleaning, but it was a great improvement. It took me a while, but I could read her name again. Mission accomplished.
customer_reviews.author: Donna L. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not sold
customer_reviews.text: So I sprayed this on my house siding a month ago... I still see the dirt on the siding. Put test patches on the on other materials like stone and wood deck.... nothing. If I scrub th begeivers out of it... it looks great. But I can say that with simple green and some elbow grease...
customer_reviews.author: Bill Reiman

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is AMAZING. I sprayed it on the green mold growing ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is AMAZING. I sprayed it on the green mold growing on my house's northside vinyl siding. I literally sprayed it on and walked away. The mold was gone the next morning and it hasn't come back. It doesn't hurt you, the bushes and flowers or the siding.
customer_reviews.author: rickv

customer_reviews.title: High price for only 1/2 gallon!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product however, pay close attention to quantity size. This is only 1/2 gallon size and for only $2 more you can get a gallon size. Total rip off for only 1/2 gallon size. I was caught off guard and wasn’t even aware it was sold in 1/2 gallon size.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Does not work/ REFUND REQUESTED
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY! I followed the directions on the bottle. This product did nothing. I could have sprayed straight water and got the same result. Amazon should not allow you to use their platform. I was instructed to wait a couple of months and it will slowly clean with rain. Also, did not work. Conveniently now, that I followed instructions and waited, they say I waited too long to return. Come on Amazon, you are better than that.
customer_reviews.author: Car collector

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. Used this product on vinyl siding and it didn't illuminate the mold/mildew. Sprayed the product on metal flashing and it did not remove any mold/mildew. Disappointing. Had to go back and spray with a generic mold and mildew remover that was bought from grocery store. It took it tdd ight off.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Stull

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Sister in law turned me on to this stuff. Here in an HOA you have to keep your gutters and facets clean. I used to have to climb a ladder and spray simple green on and wipe, with Wet and Forget I just spray and forget. It took 2 applications to work, 30 days apart, but now they look spotless and all I do is Wet and Forget
customer_reviews.author: Edward V.

product_meta.title: Wet and Forget 800003 Wet And Forget Moss Mold Mildew & Algae Stain Remover
product_meta.description: A unique combination of biodegradable selective surfactants for moss, mold, mildew and algae removal on any exterior surface. When diluted with water and applied, it immediately begins to work. Each time it rains, this safe, cleansing combination gently removes the moss, mold, mildew and algae without scrubbing or rinsing.
feature_bullets: Gentle Spray & Leave Cleaner, No Scrubbing, Rinsing or Power Washing
Safe for virtually any surface, bleach-free, biodegradable, non-acidic, no phosphates
Surfaces stay clean 1+ years in most cases

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars2,274 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping. Learn More
